column4: hi everyone! how can i make ubuntu save memory dumps after program crash?
core dumps
memory dumps of programs that crash
special configuration shouldn't be necessary. Have you looked for core.* files in your $HOME?
are these files hidden? I can't find any of them
no.
maybe the working directory of your crashed program is something other than your home dir.
i can't find anything neither in my home directory nor in the program directory :(
hmm. Are you sure your program terminated abnormally?
may be its becouse i use Kubuntu? is there a big difference besides KDE?
not really
yeah absolutelly, i provoke SIGSEGV
maybe i could find them on entire hard drive. How do these files name? *core*? or *core.*
core.*
ok thanks, i';; try to look up for them
rather than 'find', I suggest you use 'sudo updatedb ; locate core'
ok thanks
if you still can't find it, please ask again here, or try the #ubuntu-devel channel (it's not strictly ontopic there, but there are more programmers there and they might sympathize ;)
that channel really seems to be more suitable :)
it's not really for generic support, though -- wear a flame-proof vest ;)
